On Escalation Ticket # 00440964 the new comment has been added: Joe Dibley:

**Customer Setup**
This customer users OpenIdConnect with Entra ID and PingCastle Enterprise and is on 3.3.0.8.

**Manage My Account with OIDC**
The Manage My Account page only shows the following when using OIDC. This should at minimum include the "View my users claims" option.
![image.png](https://dev.azure.com/NetwrixCorporation/34efe383-f25c-4c87-b831-7e06a9c6777d/_apis/wit/attachments/07f046f6-7617-42ac-9927-11f2b832c390?fileName=image.png) 

**OIDC Claims**
The customer is attempting to use the standard role claim that we also use `http://schemas.microsoft.com/ws/2008/06/identity/claims/role` but it is not granting access to anything. They are using Entra ID as the OIDC provider so need to work out how the claims work. I think I can likely fix this specific issue.

[DevOps CommentId:11892388]

On Escalation Ticket # 00440964 the new comment has been added: Herbert Smith:

This may be the same issue as Escalation 379835 How do "Claim permissions" work?, but with regard to OpenId, rather than SAML2 - OpenId login code does not propagate claims into the PingCastleEnterprise session.

[DevOps CommentId:11906527]

On Escalation Ticket # 00440964 the new comment has been added: Herbert Smith:

The missing 'View my user's claims' and 'View my sessions' options have been returned in code changes for User Story 381362 [Ticket] SAML2 users can create a local password
